Configuration.XmlContent: <objectConfig> <item name="SmtpHost">192.168.10.1</item> <item name="SmtpPort">25</item> <item name="From">xrouter-service@xrouter.dyndns.info</item> <item name="FromDisplayName">XRouter</item> <item name="Subject">Kontrola podezřelých transakcí - příliš vysoká částka</item> <item name="Body">Tento mail byl vygenerován vrámci kontroly podezřelých transakcí: došlo k překročení hlídaného limitu celkové částky na jedné účtence.</item> <item name="To"> <element>petersob@seznam.cz</element> <element>xrouter-admin@xrouter.dyndns.info</element> <element>sobeslav.benda@seznam.cz</element> <element>miro.cicko@gmail.com</element> <element>tomas.kroupa@hotmail.com</element> <element>bohumir.zamecnik@gmail.com</element> </item> <item name="AreInputTokensPersistent">False</item> </objectConfig>

adapter-type.name: Directory I/O adapter
adapter-type.description: Reads and writes files from/into specified directories.

ItemMetadata.Name: AreInputTokensPersistent
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: If checked the message flow state of each token originated from this adapter will be persistently stored (eg. in a database) after performing each step in the message flow processing.

Type.d5p1:ClrTypeFullName: System.Collections.Concurrent.ConcurrentDictionary`2[[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089],[System.String, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]]

adapter-type.name: E-mail sender adapter
adapter-type.description: It can send e-mails with a XML message attached.

ItemMetadata.Name: SmtpHost
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: Host-name or IP adress of the SMTP server.

ItemMetadata.Name: SmtpPort
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: Port where the SMTP server listens.

ItemMetadata.Name: From
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: Source address of the e-mail message sender.

ItemMetadata.Name: FromDisplayName
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: Display name of the e-mail message sender.

ItemMetadata.Name: Subject
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: The subject line of the e-mail message.

ItemMetadata.Name: To
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: A list of e-mail addresses of recipients of this e-mail message.

ItemMetadata.Name: AreInputTokensPersistent
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: If checked the message flow state of each token originated from this adapter will be persistently stored (eg. in a database) after performing each step in the message flow processing.

adapter-type.name: HTTP client adapter
adapter-type.description: Provides a HTTP client which can send messages to remote web services.

ItemMetadata.Name: Uri
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: URI of the target web service. Example: 'http://www.example.com:8080/path/'.

ItemMetadata.Name: AreInputTokensPersistent
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: If checked the message flow state of each token originated from this adapter will be persistently stored (eg. in a database) after performing each step in the message flow processing.

adapter-type.name: HTTP service adapter
adapter-type.description: Provides a simple web service listener which can receive messages.

ItemMetadata.Name: Uri
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: It is composed of a scheme (http), host name, (optional) port, and (optional) path. Example: 'http://www.example.com:8080/path/'.

ItemMetadata.Name: AreInputTokensPersistent
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: If checked the message flow state of each token originated from this adapter will be persistently stored (eg. in a database) after performing each step in the message flow processing.

action-type.name: Message sender
action-type.description: Sends a message to a specified output endpoint.

action-type.name: Xslt transformer
action-type.description: Does xslt tansformation of a specified message.

ItemMetadata.Name: xlstUri
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: XRM URI of the XSLT (XPath for selecting the XSLT from XRM)

ItemMetadata.Name: inputMessageSelection
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: XPath for selecting the input message from a token

ItemMetadata.Name: isXsltTrusted
ItemMetadata.UserDescription: Allows embedded script blocks and the XSLT document() function. These are optional features which can be exploited by a malicious user. Allow it only if the XSLT comes from a trusted source.

Configuration.d17p1:XmlContent: <objectConfig> <item name="targetGatewayName">gateway</item> <item name="targetAdapterName">Email</item> <item name="targetEndpointName"></item> <item name="messageSelection">$receipt</item> <item name="metadataSelection"></item> <item name="resultMessageName">email</item> <item name="timeoutInSeconds">30</item> </objectConfig>
